revised_title: Observations of the 1732 Moon Eclipse in Fleet Street, London
tldr: In November 1732, Mr. Geo. Graham observed a lunar eclipse in Fleet Street, London, using a small telescope. The eclipse began at 8:30 apparent time, with immersion at 9:59:30, emersion at 10:38:00, and ending at 11:37:00. Mr. Hodgson at Christ's-Hospital also observed the event with a foot telescope.
